help-file.title: CHARING "CITY OF ELVES"
help-file.content:
Charing is a small quiet forest community set in the northeastern corner of Evermeet Continent that welcomes Elf, Centaur and Half-elf visitors. What it lacks in size it makes up in beauty. Massive oak tress filled with birds, small creatures and sparkling rivers make for the most serene setting. In the southeast section of the forest stands the Great Tree of Charing. Here is your gateway to the city above.
The Palace of the City of Charing is the host for many of the Elven dignitaries. Towering behind a pair of impressive gates, the spires are truly one to be seen. Just south of the Palace on the "Way of the Royals" is the Warriors guild, where the impressive guardians of Charing train. Continuing south is a beautiful fountain in the shape of a mermaid, this is also the center of town. Heading down the east trail takes you past several entertainment areas. You have the Grovetree Theatre, the home of the renowned Grovesinger's Troupe, who are said to give the highest quality of performance almost anywhere. After the performance shop by and let Nelanna serve up some of the local brew.
Continuing down the trail is the Tower of High Magic. Hundreds of students a year stop here hoping to study with the most respected sorceress Morlyntra and her brother conjurer Morlander. When the hunger strikes you, head back to the west of the trail and stop by The Blue Dragon Restaurant. Gaston Reglia the master chef is noted for his elegant meals and the seating is limited! West of the restaurant is the Rangers guild. A small wooden structure that offers Rangers from all around a safe place to train and hold council. If you would like to join them in their daily hunts, Alkatia's Fletcher shop just south of the fountain offers a fine selection of longbows, arrows and quivers. Keep going south of Alkatia's and you'll find the Bank of Charing and finally you can settle the end of the day at the Olde Inn of Charing across the street.
Amenities: --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Inn, Bank, Equipment Lockers, Armor Shop, Weapon Shop, Supply Store, Pet Store, Magic Shop, Restaurant.
Teachers: --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Warrior, Ranger, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Conjurer, Bard, Thief.
Statistics: --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Written by Melkivar, Evermeet Continent, 1-20 suggested levels (garden and forest animals), Warning: only Elf, Centaur and Half-Elves may enter.
